nodes.label:
First tag with stable version
of gp-load-balancer

Release Notes for v1.0.0 Policy
Management applied to files rebuilt
through Cloud Version. Maintained History
for Policy Management changes (Past/Current).
Added Glasswall icon in the
MAC build. Removed Electron from
Menu bar on MAC build.
Added Geotiff file support to
the Policy Management both Docker
and Cloud Analysis of files
rebuild has been integrated in
cloud and docker. New docker
rebuild image TAG integrated. Bugs
Fixes: Correct File is getting
saved on custom location after
rebuild. Fixed sorting in-case of
multi page Fixed alignment under
session page.

Release Notes for v0.9.0 Added
Threat Intelligence to the cloud
rebuild, Displayed threat level on
the UI Watermark added for
rebuild PDF file. Buy Token
feature added under setting. Bugs
Fixes: On rebuilding the file
using Cloud user is displayed
the wrong time under session.
Fixed sorting in-case of multi
page Fixed alignment under session
page. Fixed analysis report earlier
it was showing High for
all the files. Error message
being displayed incase file is
blocked due to Policy. Fixed
alignment on mouse hover on
Flat and Hierarchy label on
Cloud and Docker page Session
page not getting loaded in
case no session is present.
Raw Logs added in multi-line
format in case logs are
very long. (Removed horizontal scroll
bar) Color of all the
buttons under different pages made
in sync. Aligned the text
on each page Provide an
interface to update the GW
image name. Saving files in
destination folder as it get
processed.

Release Notes for v0.1.7 Policy
Control & Management : UI
and Backend (Policy view, Edit,
Save, Apply to docker container).
Threat Analysis : Integrated Threat
analysis of files rebuilt with
docker. Integrated processing target with
rebuilt sessions metadata : Cloud/Docker.
UI Enhancement and some minor
fixes.

Release Notes for v0.1.6 Added
support for Parallel & Sequential
execution of requests with docker.
Added Threat Intelligence to the
application, Displayed threat level on
the UI. Session History: Added
session history tab which list
all the rebuild sessions (Cloud
and Local). Rebuild & File
analysis event logging: Added separate
tab to capture RAW logs
using a file backed logger.
Made server configuration configurable. Fixed
google universal analytics issues and
downloads are now visible on
GA. UI Enhancement and some
minor fixes.

Release Notes for v0.1.5 Local
rebuild health check : To
check the local rebuild configuration
and it state    
    a) If docker
Installed.        
b)f docker running.    
    c) If GW
image present else pull.  
      d) If
GW image licensed. Health check
event logging: Added the event
logs for docker health check.
Rebuild & File analysis event
logging: Added the event logs
for local Rebuild and file
analysis. Added health check functionality
on UI. Made output path
persistent across rebuilds. UI Enhancement
and some minor fixes

Release Notes for v0.1.4 Processing
rebuild locally through Docker after
pulling the docker image. Creating
analysis report for rebuilt files
locally through Docker. Added option
for User to rebuild app
either locally or through cloud.
Modified the ReadMe with steps
to run rebuild locally through
docker. Added option for User
to rebuild app either locally
or through cloud. Git link
for above changes:
https://github.com/k8-proxy/glasswall-
desktop/pull/95 Creating
analysis report for rebuilt files
locally through Docker.

1. Fixed Video link 2.
Fixed Help Shortcut 4. Updated
ReadMe for the new version

1. FIxed website link 2.
Fixed Linux broken link

First release - online version
of GW desktop

Github Actions workflow for ICAP-server,
proxy-rebuild, k8-rebuild and monitoring. -
ICAP server packer - OVA/AMI
for Monitoring with the latest
improvements. - OVA/AMI for Proxy
- Remove VM process

Release V5.1.0 contains the following
tested pieces: 1.- CI/CD process
to build and deploy the
AMI. 2.- Monitoring improvements: *
Automate agent installation for each
OVA * Dockerise monitoring OVA
* Add Packetbeat, APM and
Logstash features 3.- Vmware scrips:
* Integration with syslog *
How long did Health Check
run e.g. how long we
are waiting for page. 4.-
AMI and OVA for File
Drop(k8-rebuild) * New OVA: s3://glasswall-
sow-ova/vms/SOW-REST/k8-rebuild-
export-i-08e0457b0a29335ed.ova
* Updated documentation: https://github.com/k
8-proxy/k8-rebuild/blob/main/documentation.md
#importing-file-drop-ova-to-aws

* UI Updates - interface
supports trigger load - UI
Interface supports load agains direct
icap, via proxy offline site
and proxied Sharepoint - stop
tests from UI - performance
test summary results table *
ICAPServer Performance Test and Analytics
Ubuntu AMI is published in
all supported regions (AWS Ireland,
North Virginia, Oregon and North
California) * Implemented results automatic
analyser. * Both dashboard and
load generators are now based
on Ubuntu 20.04 * Weekly
packer build AMI/OVA with github
actions.

- Configured AWS Cloud Formation
stack to automatically create the
infrastructure to generate traffic &
run tests - Implemented input
mechanism to retrieve required files
for processing from S3 -
Implemented assertion mechanism that
validates
the response code returned from
ICAP server. - Implemented Influx
DB logging solution to log
the performance metrics - Implemented
monitoring feature using Grafana for
detailed metrics dashboard display -
Implemented the mechanism to dynamically
create EC2 instances based on
the number of users in
the test run. - Implemented
a mechanism to dynamically assign
users to each ec2 instance.
